title: Weighted spatial tessellations in constrained domains
text: Spatial allocation around point locations recurring requirement ecology socialâ€“ecological research, including delineation settlement influence zones, species territories, management areas. Voronoi tessellations provide simple transparent framework dividing space among generators, standard implementations assume uniform influence unconstrained Euclidean distance. weightedVoronoi package extends framework allowing () generator-specific weights (ii) tessellations constrained arbitrary polygonal domains using either Euclidean geodesic distance. vignette demonstrates use package representative example complex domain boundary.

title: Weighted spatial tessellations in constrained domains
text: first define concave, irregular spatial domain set generator points heterogeneous weights.
code: library(sf) library(weightedVoronoi)  crs_use <- 32636  # projected CRS (metres)  boundary_sf <- make_irregular_boundary()  set.seed(42)  pts <- st_sample(boundary_sf, size = 8, type = "random") points_sf <- st_sf(   village = paste0("V", seq_along(pts)),   population = round(exp(rnorm(length(pts), log(300), 0.8))),   geometry = pts,   crs = crs_use )  plot(st_geometry(boundary_sf), border = "black", lwd = 2) plot(st_geometry(points_sf), add = TRUE, pch = 21, bg = "red")

title: Weighted spatial tessellations in constrained domains
text: first generate weighted tessellation using Euclidean distance. Generator influence scaled using logarithmic transformation population weights.
code: out_euc <- weighted_voronoi_domain(   points_sf = points_sf,   weight_col = "population",   boundary_sf = boundary_sf,   res = 10,   weight_transform = log10,   distance = "euclidean",   clip_to_boundary = TRUE,   verbose = FALSE )  plot(st_geometry(boundary_sf), border = "black", lwd = 2) plot(out_euc$polygons["generator_id"], add = TRUE) plot(st_geometry(points_sf), add = TRUE, pch = 21, bg = "red")

title: Weighted spatial tessellations in constrained domains
text: now generate tessellation using geodesic distance, distances constrained paths entirely within domain.
code: out_geo <- weighted_voronoi_domain(   points_sf = points_sf,   weight_col = "population",   boundary_sf = boundary_sf,   res = 10,   weight_transform = log10,   distance = "geodesic",   close_mask = TRUE,   close_iters = 1,   verbose = FALSE )  plot(st_geometry(boundary_sf), border = "black", lwd = 2) plot(out_geo$polygons["generator_id"], add = TRUE) plot(st_geometry(points_sf), add = TRUE, pch = 21, bg = "red")

title: Weighted spatial tessellations in constrained domains
text: Although tessellations fully partition domain, differ influence propagates concave boundaries narrow corridors. Euclidean tessellation allocates regions based straight-line distance within rasterised domain, whereas geodesic tessellation respects domain geometry prevents influence across inaccessible areas. differences reflected visually generator-level summary tables returned software.

title: Weighted Euclidean tessellation (core) â€” weighted_voronoi
text: points_sf sf POINT object containing generator locations attributes. weight_col Character. Name weight column points_sf. boundary Optional sf polygon defining tessellation domain. Used template_rast NULL. template_rast Optional terra::SpatRaster template raster. Provide instead boundary + res. res Numeric. Raster resolution CRS units (e.g. metres). weight_transform Function. Transforms weights allocation. Must return finite, strictly positive values. method Character. Allocation method; one "argmin" "partition". max_dist Optional numeric. Maximum Euclidean distance consider (euclidean ). verbose Logical. TRUE, prints progress. island_min_cells Integer. Minimum patch size used island removal. island_fill_iter Integer. Maximum iterations filling reassigned cells.
